byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin reported from Milwaukee, and Patrick Healy from New York.
byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and PATRICK HEALY

abstract: Republican presidential contenders clash over immigration and economics during debate in Milwaukee, offering substantive picture of policy differences in campaign dominated by personality and bluster; former Florida Gov Jeb Bush and Ohio Gov John Kasich seek to present practical solutions to immigration policies while criticizing Donald Trump's deportation plan.
lead_paragraph: Gov. John Kasich of Ohio and former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida tried to gain political momentum by heaping scorn on Donald J. Trump’s plan to deport unauthorized immigrants.

headline.main: In Republican Debate, Candidates Battle Sharply on Immigration
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Candidates Battle Sharply on Immigration

snippet: Gov. John Kasich of Ohio and former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida tried to gain political momentum by heaping scorn on Donald J. Trump’s plan to deport unauthorized immigrants.
